definitions.body: spoil, plunder (usu. identif. with I. ´[[שׁ]]:; NH id. (Jastr, cf. Dalm); As. šalâlu, id.; Hom:Chr 33 cp. Sab. [[תַלל]] plunder, connecting this with Ar. 3al=ah;un a flock of sheep (or goats); then Targum [[שְׁלָלָא]] booty, and (rare) Syr. 4elol are loan-words);—

[[שׁׂלְלִים]] Zec 2:12, etc.;—spoil, plunder (usu. ‖[[בָּזַז ]]), c. acc. cogn. [[שָׁלָל]] Is 10:6, Ez Eze 29:19, Eze 38:12, Eze 38:13, Eze 38:13, acc. definitions.title: Hithpō‘
definitions.body: Pf. 3 pl. [[אֶשְׁתּוֹלְלוּ]] [[אַבִּירֵי לֵב]] ([[א]] in ´[[אֶשְׁתּ]]: is Aram., or scribal error: Ges:§ 54 a n., cf. 58 k) Ps 76:6 the stout of heart are spoiled; Pt. [[מִשְׁתּוֹלֵל]] Is 59:15 he that departs from evil is one despoiled.
